snippet: Scores have been rescued after a blizzard killed at least 27 hikers on one of Nepal’s most popular hiking routes.
abstract: Nepal's army and police rescue more than 70 hikers trapped by freakish, violent snowstorm while trekking across Thorong La pass in Himalayas; bodies of seven trekkers, six of them visitors from other countries and one Nepali, are retrieved and number is expected to rise, because many bodies are presumed to be buried under several feet of snow; dozens more hikers are safe but snowbound in remote lodges.

byline.original: By BHADRA SHARMA, ELLEN BARRY and RAJNEESH BHANDARI
byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma and Rajneesh Bhandari reported from Katmandu, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi. Nida Najar and Hari Kumar contributed reporting from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Scores have been rescued after a blizzard killed at least 27 hikers on one of Nepal’s most popular hiking routes.

headline.main: Life-and-Death Choices in a Himalayan Blizzard
headline.print_headline: Life-and-Death Choices in a Himalayan Blizzard
